input_text:
Job Title: Warehouse Journeyman

Location: Orange, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Requisition ID: 158486 

Position Summary

Participate and/or supervise effective onsite Material; Care Custody and Control functions in support of field activities. Direct and/or perform daily operation functions for project facilities including inventory control, filling of field requisitions, staging and preparation of materials for field installation and support of QA/QC efforts.

Experience Level

Experienced

Primary Responsibilities And Duties

 Oversee Facility Operations and duties of onsite Warehouse Personnel and trainees. Participate in workload as required and direct Facility activities. Assist with requisitions and issue of material and assist with status of materials shorts; Implement and manage a plan to purchase basic daily shorts. Establish and direct onsite Bag and Tag documentation duties for Warehouse operations. Assist with material staging/delivery to discipline and coordinate with off-site shipping when needed Supervise Material document production, per project specific plan, direct onsite communication of materials information. Maintain records for accuracy and completeness. Attend onsite staff and discipline support meetings as required. Work closely with all Material Manager and Project Procurement for bulk materials inventories, material needs, material deliveries, status of material on order, backorders, re-orders etc.

Qualifications

 May require a high school diploma or its equivalent with previous years of experience in the field or in a related area. Must possess strong working knowledge skills and abilities for position. Ability to understand, follow and transmit written and oral instructions and communicate effectively with management/supervision. Proficient in the safe and efficient use of electrical, hand tools, power tools and layout tools as well as measurement tools

Requirements

 The person in this position needs to constantly move about a construction/industrial site,

so should be able to stand, walk, sit, reach, stoop, kneel, crouch, and/or crawl

 Constantly works in a construction environment and will be exposed to changing outdoor

weather conditions

 Work irregular hours, weekends, overtime and holidays as required May be required to use ladders/mechanical platforms/manlifts/scaffold to access h

required equipment/work areas (may exceed 200 feet), so must be able to climb and

maintain balance on formwork, steel formwork, stairs, ladders and scaffolds

 Move and work in and around confined and cluttered places, and uneven surfaces Must be able to complete tasks in a noisy and dusty environment May be required/able to move items weighing up to 50 pounds across

construction/industrial site

 Must have required tools Observe and comply with all safety and project rules, perform other duties as required Ability to pass pre-access drug and alcohol testing, fit for duty

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Warehouse Journeyman
output_json.summary: Participate and/or supervise effective onsite Material; Care Custody and Control functions in support of field activities.
job_responsibilities: Oversee Facility Operations and duties of onsite Warehouse Personnel and trainees.
Participate in workload as required and direct Facility activities.
Assist with requisitions and issue of material and assist with status of materials shorts.
Implement and manage a plan to purchase basic daily shorts.
Establish and direct onsite Bag and Tag documentation duties for Warehouse operations.
Assist with material staging/delivery to discipline and coordinate with off-site shipping when needed.
Supervise Material document production, per project specific plan, direct onsite communication of materials information.
Maintain records for accuracy and completeness.
Attend onsite staff and discipline support meetings as required.
Work closely with all Material Manager and Project Procurement for bulk materials inventories, material needs, material deliveries, status of material on order, backorders, re-orders etc.
output_json.physical_requirements: Constantly move about a construction/industrial site, so should be able to stand, walk, sit, reach, stoop, kneel, crouch, and/or crawl. Constantly works in a construction environment and will be exposed to changing outdoor weather conditions. Work irregular hours, weekends, overtime and holidays as required. May be required to use ladders/mechanical platforms/manlifts/scaffold to access heights exceeding 200 feet, so must be able to climb and maintain balance on formwork, steel formwork, stairs, ladders and scaffolds. Move and work in and around confined and cluttered places, and uneven surfaces. Must be able to complete tasks in a noisy and dusty environment. May be required/able to move items weighing up to 50 pounds across construction/industrial site.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
